result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jayson Sevcik

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Gary Kryshak
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

Court questions victims rights notification.
ADA Cassidy indicates that the state in in compliance with victim rights and no victim appears for today's hearing.

3:13 PM Defendant Jayson Sevcik in court.  Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Jayson Sevcik.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls the case.
ADA Cassidy states the appearances.

Parties are ready to proceed.
3:13 p.m.  Officer S Morton is sworn in.
Direct examination by ADA Cassidy.
3:18 p.m.  Witness identifies the defendant.
Cross examination by Atty Kryshak.
3:19 p.m.  ADA Cassidy has no redirect.
Witness is excused.
Neither party has additional or further witnesses and no final argument.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

3:06 PM Defendant Jayson Sevcik appeared by video, in custody Waupaca County Jail.  Attorney (Atty) Gary J. Kryshak in court for Jayson Sevcik.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. Bond Motion to Modify Bond
Atty Kryshak statements in support of defense motion to modify bond conditions.
ADA Cassidy states objections to the motion to modify bond.
Atty Kryshak makes further statements.
Court reviews case 22CF245.
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is present.
ADA Cassidy states the victim is not in agreement with modifying the bond.
BY THE COURT: Motion to modify bond is denied.
Prelim rescheduled from 9/26/2022 to 10/10/2022 at 3:00 p.m. due to a conflict with the Defense Attorney's calendar.
Preliminary hearing on October 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

3:04 PM Defendant Jayson Sevcik appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gary J. Kryshak in court for Jayson Sevcik.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
filed by the State
Affidavit of Gary J Kryshak (sent to Br 3 Judge/JA on 08/15/22 sp)
Notice of Motion and Motion to Amend Bail filed by Atty Gary Kryshak (sent to Br 3 Judge/JA on 08/15/22 sp)
Atty Gary Kryshak appointed
Motion hearing on September 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Initial Appearance set for 08/22/22 @ 2:30 p.m. in Br 1

No contact with victim 1 or her residence or place of employment or family members
No contact with anyone female under the age of 18 unless necessary for his employment
No contact with I.H.

1:18 PM Defendant Jayson Sevcik appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of WI.   Atty Gary Kryshak appears on behalf of the defendant.

ADA  Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault and Felony Bail Jumping.
Atty Kryshak does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $10,000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Kryshak objects to the high cash bond and states his objections on the record.
Hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
